intro: Carex karisimbiensis, commonly known as the Karisimbi sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of East Africa, particularly around the volcanic peaks of the Virunga Mountains. This plant is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests and along stream banks. Carex karisimbiensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
